title: Green Enchiladas
ingredients: 1 – pound Tomatillos (I usually get more than a pound, since I usually have to toss out a few)
instructions: First you need to make the tomatillo salsa used as part of the recipes.   Husk, wash and cut the tomatillos into quarters.  Place the tomatillos, jalapenos and water in a blender or a food processor fitted with the metal blade. Puree just until chunky. Add the remaining ingredients (Onion, Cilantro and salt) and puree about 2 minutes more, or until no large chunks remain.
Put salsa in medium soup pan and simmer for about 20 minutes.  Allow to cool.
I usually make two layers in the casserole pan, this is about 20-30 tortillas
Now it is pretty much assembly line.  I set up on a counter next to microwave, with the pan of green tomatillo salsa, casserole dish, and the cheese/ meat nearby.
Take your tortillas a few at a time, wrap in slightly damp paper towel and put in microwave for 20 seconds.
Submerge the tortillas (one at a time) in the salsa.
Remove and place in casserole dish.
Roll up (like a cigar) and place in casserole dish.
Once you have filled your casserole dish Pour remaining salsa on top of the enchiladas.  Add cheese on top of the casserole as well.
Garnish – Mexican Crema little drizzled over the enchiladas
